metadata.title: CVE-2022-28321 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description: The Linux-PAM package before 1.5.2-6.1 for openSUSE Tumbleweed allowsauthentication bypass for SSH logins. The pam_access.so module doesn'tcorrectly restrict login if a user tries to connect from an IP address thatis not resolvable via DNS. In such conditions, a user with denied access toa machine can still get access. NOTE: the relevance of this issue islargely limited to openSUSE Tumbleweed and openSUSE Factory; it does notaffect Linux-PAM upstream.

criterions.comment: pam: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
